original: @ga_@#/_/tshhad ma rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo zhes🔽bya ba'i rab tu byed pa bzhugs/🔽@##/_/rgya gar skad du/_n+ya ya pra be sha na ma pra ma ni pra ka ra ni/
analyzed: @ga_@#/_/tshhad ma rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa bzhugs/ @##/_/rgya gar skad du/_n+ya ya pra be sha na ma pra ma ni pra ka ra ni/
translated: The Entrance to the Way of Valid Knowledge🔽The Entrance to the Way of Valid Knowledge

original: bod skad du/_tshhad ma rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa/
analyzed: bod skad du/_tshhad ma rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa/
translated: Called “The Door to the Right Way of Reasoning”🔽Homage to youthful Mañjuśrī!

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshhal lo/_/sgrub pa dang ni sun 'byin
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshhal lo/_/sgrub pa dang ni sun 'byin
translated: The treatise is summarized in this verse:🔽In order to understand the opponent’s position,

original: nyid/_/ltar snang bcas pa gzhan rtogs phyir/_/mngon sum dang ni rjes su
analyzed: nyid/_/ltar snang bcas pa gzhan rtogs phyir/_/mngon sum dang ni rjes su
translated: one must state the proof and the refutation,🔽along with the fallacies.🔽In order to understand one’s own position,

original: dpag_/ltar snang bcas pa bdag rig phyir/_/ces pa bstan bcos🔽bsdus pa'o/_/de la phyogs la sogs pa brjod pa rnams sgrub par byed pa ste/🔽phyogs dang gtan tshhigs dang dpe brjod pa rnams ni phyir rgol rnams kyis ma
analyzed: dpag_/ltar snang bcas pa bdag rig phyir/_/ces pa bstan bcos bsdus pa'o/_/de la phyogs la sogs pa brjod pa rnams sgrub par byed pa ste/ phyogs dang gtan tshhigs dang dpe brjod pa rnams ni phyir rgol rnams kyis ma
translated: one must state the direct perception and the inference,🔽along with the fallacies.🔽The statements of the position and so forth are the proofs.🔽The statements of the position, the reasons, and the examples are for the purpose of making the opponent understand the meaning that he or she has not understood.

original: rtogs pa'i don rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o/_/de la phyogs ni
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o/_/de la phyogs ni
translated: The position is the thesis that one wishes to prove.

original: rab tu grags pa'i chos can rab tu grags pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa
analyzed: rab tu grags pa'i chos can rab tu grags pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa
translated: The subject is well known, and it is qualified by a well known distinction.

original: rang gis sgrub bya kho nar 'dod pa mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa med pa can
analyzed: rang gis sgrub bya kho nar 'dod pa mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa med pa can
translated: It is not invalidated by perception and so forth, which are only accepted by the opponent.🔽For example, “Sound is impermanent.” The reason has three parts.

original: 'di lta ste/_sgra mi rtag ces pa lta bu'o/_/gtan tshhigs ni tshhul gsum mo/_/🔽tshhad ma rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa bzhugs/
analyzed: 'di lta ste/_sgra mi rtag ces pa lta bu'o/_/gtan tshhigs ni tshhul gsum mo/_/ tshhad ma rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa bzhugs/
translated: The three parts of a reason

original: tshhul gsum po de yang gang zhe na/_phyogs kyi chos nyid dang /_mthun pa'i
analyzed: tshhul gsum po de yang gang zhe na/_phyogs kyi chos nyid dang /_mthun pa'i
translated: What are those three parts? The property of the subject, the forward pervasion, and the counter pervasion.

original: phyogs nyid la yod par nges pa dang /_mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du🔽nges pa yang ngo /_/mthun pa'i phyogs de yang gang /_mi mthun pa'i phyogs de
analyzed: phyogs nyid la yod par nges pa dang /_mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa yang ngo /_/mthun pa'i phyogs de yang gang /_mi mthun pa'i phyogs de
translated: The forward pervasion is the certainty that the reason exists only in similar instances. The counter pervasion is the certainty that the reason does not exist in any dissimilar instances.

original: gang zhe na/_bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyis don mtshhungs pa nyid mthun pa'i
analyzed: gang zhe na/_bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyis don mtshhungs pa nyid mthun pa'i
translated: What are similar instances and what are dissimilar instances? Similar instances are those that are similar to the object of affirmation by virtue of sharing the same property.

original: phyogs te/_'di ltar sgra mi rtag par bsgrub pa la bum pa la sogs pa yang mi
analyzed: phyogs te/_'di ltar sgra mi rtag par bsgrub pa la bum pa la sogs pa yang mi
translated: For example, in the proof of sound as impermanent, a vase and so forth are similar instances. Dissimilar instances are those that are dissimilar to the object of affirmation by virtue of not sharing the same property.

original: rtag pa yin pas mthun phyogs so/_/mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni gang la bsgrub par
analyzed: rtag pa yin pas mthun phyogs so/_/mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni gang la bsgrub par
translated: The concordant side is that which is permanent. The discordant side is that which is not to be established.

original: bya ba med pa ste/_gang rtag pa yin pa de byas pa ma yin par mthong ste
analyzed: bya ba med pa ste/_gang rtag pa yin pa de byas pa ma yin par mthong ste
translated: Whatever is permanent is seen to be unproduced.

original: / dper na nam mkha' bzhin zhes pa'o/_/de la byas pa nyid dam/_btshal ma🔽thag tu byung ba phyogs kyi chos nyid dang bsgrub par bya ba med pa pal med pa nyid
analyzed: / dper na nam mkha' bzhin zhes pa'o/_/de la byas pa nyid dam/_btshal ma thag tu byung ba phyogs kyi chos nyid dang bsgrub par bya ba med pa pal med pa nyid
translated: For example, it is like space.🔽In that, the property of the position is the very production or the arising immediately after the cause.🔽The probandum is the absence of the absence of permanence.

original: du nges pa zhes pa mi rtag pa la gtan tshhigs so/_/dpe ni gnyis su dbye ste/
analyzed: du nges pa zhes pa mi rtag pa la gtan tshhigs so/_/dpe ni gnyis su dbye ste/
translated: The example is divided into two:

original: chos mthun pa dang /_chos mi mthun pa yang ngo /_/de la chos mthun pa ni gang
analyzed: chos mthun pa dang /_chos mi mthun pa yang ngo /_/de la chos mthun pa ni gang
translated: the concordant and the discordant.

original: la gtan tshhigs kyi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa ston pa ste/_gang byas pa de
analyzed: la gtan tshhigs kyi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa ston pa ste/_gang byas pa de
translated: The concordant is that which shows the presence of the reason in the concordant side.🔽Whatever is produced is seen to be impermanent.

original: mi rtag par mthong ste/_dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin zhes pa'o/_/chos
analyzed: mi rtag par mthong ste/_dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin zhes pa'o/_/chos
translated: For example, it is like a pot and so forth.

original: mi mthun pa yang /_gang la bsgrub par bya ba med pa la rtags med pa nyid du
analyzed: mi mthun pa yang /_gang la bsgrub par bya ba med pa la rtags med pa nyid du
translated: The discordant is that which shows the absence of the reason in the absence of the probandum.

original: ston pa ste/_gang rtag pa de byas pa ma yin te/_dper na nam mkha' bzhin🔽zhes pa'o/_/rtag pa'i sgras ni 'dir mi rtag pa nyid med par brjod pa yin la/
analyzed: ston pa ste/_gang rtag pa de byas pa ma yin te/_dper na nam mkha' bzhin zhes pa'o/_/rtag pa'i sgras ni 'dir mi rtag pa nyid med par brjod pa yin la/
translated: The teacher says: That which is permanent is not a product, like space.

original: byas pa ma yin pa'i sgras kyang byas pa med par ro/_/ji ltar yod dang med dag
analyzed: byas pa ma yin pa'i sgras kyang byas pa med par ro/_/ji ltar yod dang med dag
translated: The word “permanent” here means not impermanent, and the word “not a product” means not produced.🔽The word “exists” refers to the position and so on.

original: yod ces smras pa phyogs la sogs pa rnams so/_/'di rnams kyi brjod pa rnams
analyzed: yod ces smras pa phyogs la sogs pa rnams so/_/'di rnams kyi brjod pa rnams
translated: When these are expressed,

original: ni gzhan gyis rab tu rtogs pa'i dus na sgrub par byed pa ste/_'di ltar sgra mi
analyzed: ni gzhan gyis rab tu rtogs pa'i dus na sgrub par byed pa ste/_'di ltar sgra mi
translated: at the time of being understood by others, they are established.

original: rtag ces pa ni phyogs brjod pa'o/_/byas pa'i phyir zhes pa phyogs kyi chos brjod
analyzed: rtag ces pa ni phyogs brjod pa'o/_/byas pa'i phyir zhes pa phyogs kyi chos brjod
translated: Thus, “sound is impermanent” expresses the position, and “because it is produced” expresses the property of the position.

original: pa nyid do/_/gang byas pa de ni mi rtag par mthong ste dper na bum pa bzhin🔽zhes pa mthun phyogs la rjes su 'gro bar brjod do/_/gang rtag pa yin pa de
analyzed: pa nyid do/_/gang byas pa de ni mi rtag par mthong ste dper na bum pa bzhin zhes pa mthun phyogs la rjes su 'gro bar brjod do/_/gang rtag pa yin pa de
translated: “Whatever is produced is seen to be impermanent, like a pot” expresses the presence of the reason in similar instances.

original: byas pa ma yin par mthong ste/_dper na nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin zhes pa
analyzed: byas pa ma yin par mthong ste/_dper na nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin zhes pa
translated: “Whatever is permanent is seen to be not produced, like space and so on” expresses the absence of the reason in dissimilar instances.

original: bzlog pa brjod pa'o/_/'di rnams nyid gsum yan lag ces brjod do/_/🔽bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa la yang mngon sum la sogs pas bsal ba rnams
analyzed: bzlog pa brjod pa'o/_/'di rnams nyid gsum yan lag ces brjod do/_/ bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa la yang mngon sum la sogs pas bsal ba rnams
translated: The three branches of the refutation are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the proof are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the counter-thesis are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the counter-refutation are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the counter-proof are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the counter-example are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the counter-application are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the counter-conclusion are the thesis, the reason, and the example.

original: phyogs ltar snang ba ste/_'di ltar mngon sum gyis bsal ba dang /_rjes su🔽dpag pas bsal ba dang /_'jig rten pas bsal ba dang /_yid ches pas
analyzed: phyogs ltar snang ba ste/_'di ltar mngon sum gyis bsal ba dang /_rjes su dpag pas bsal ba dang /_'jig rten pas bsal ba dang /_yid ches pas
translated: The three branches of the counter-reversal are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽These are called the three branches.🔽The three branches of the thesis are the thesis itself, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the refutation are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the proof are the thesis, the reason, and the example.

original: bsal ba dang /_rang gi tshhig gis bsal ba dang /_khyad par rab tu grags🔽pa ma yin pa dang /_khyad par can rab tu grags pa ma yin pa dang /_gnyis
analyzed: bsal ba dang /_rang gi tshhig gis bsal ba dang /_khyad par rab tu grags pa ma yin pa dang /_khyad par can rab tu grags pa ma yin pa dang /_gnyis
translated: The three branches of the counter-thesis are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the counter-refutation are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the counter-proof are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the counter-example are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the counter-application are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the counter-conclusion are the thesis, the reason, and the example.

original: ka rab tu grags pa ma yin pa dang /_grags pas bsal ba yang ste zhes so/_/🔽de la mngon sum gyis gnod pa ni/_dper na sgra mnyan bya ba ma yin zhes pa lta
analyzed: ka rab tu grags pa ma yin pa dang /_grags pas bsal ba yang ste zhes so/_/ de la mngon sum gyis gnod pa ni/_dper na sgra mnyan bya ba ma yin zhes pa lta
translated: The three branches of the counter-reversal are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽These are called the three branches.🔽The three branches of the thesis are the thesis itself, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the refutation are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the proof are the thesis, the reason, and the example.🔽The three branches of the counter-thesis are the thesis, the reason, and the example.

original: bu'o/_/rjes su dpag pas gnod pa ni/_/dper na bum pa rtag ces pa lta
analyzed: bu'o/_/rjes su dpag pas gnod pa ni/_/dper na bum pa rtag ces pa lta
translated: The three branches of the counter-refutation are the thesis, the reason,

original: bu'o/_/'jig rten gyis gnod pa ni/_dper na mi'i mgo thod gtshang ste/
analyzed: bu'o/_/'jig rten gyis gnod pa ni/_dper na mi'i mgo thod gtshang ste/
translated: The world can contradict it, as when it is said that the head is a part of the body

original: sems can gyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir/_dung dang nya phyis zhes pa bzhin zhes pa
analyzed: sems can gyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir/_dung dang nya phyis zhes pa bzhin zhes pa
translated: because it is a part of a sentient being, like a conch or an oyster.🔽The mind can contradict it, as when the Vaisheshikas prove that sound is

original: lta bu'o/_/yid ches pas gnod pa ni dper na bye brag pas sgra rtag ces bsgrub
analyzed: lta bu'o/_/yid ches pas gnod pa ni dper na bye brag pas sgra rtag ces bsgrub
translated: permanent.

original: pa lta bu'o/_/rang gi tshhig gis gnod pa ni dper na nga'i ma mo gsham zhes pa lta
analyzed: pa lta bu'o/_/rang gi tshhig gis gnod pa ni dper na nga'i ma mo gsham zhes pa lta
translated: One’s own words can contradict it, as when one says, “My mother is barren.”

original: bu'o/_/khyad par rab tu grags pa ma yin pa ni/_dper na sangs rgyas pas
analyzed: bu'o/_/khyad par rab tu grags pa ma yin pa ni/_dper na sangs rgyas pas
translated: It can be a special case that is not well known, as when a Buddhist says to🔽a Samkhya, “Sound is impermanent.”

original: grangs can pa la sgra 'jig ces pa lta bu'o/_/khyad par can rab tu grags pa ma
analyzed: grangs can pa la sgra 'jig ces pa lta bu'o/_/khyad par can rab tu grags pa ma
translated: It can be a special case that is not well known, as when a Samkhya says to

original: yin pa ni/_dper na grangs can pas sangs rgyas pa la bdag ni sems dpa'
analyzed: yin pa ni/_dper na grangs can pas sangs rgyas pa la bdag ni sems dpa'
translated: a Buddhist, “The self is the enjoyer.”

original: can zhes pa lta bu'o/_/gnyis ka rab tu grags pa ma yin pa ni/_dper na bye
analyzed: can zhes pa lta bu'o/_/gnyis ka rab tu grags pa ma yin pa ni/_dper na bye
translated: It can be a case that is not well known to both, as when a Vaisheshika says

original: brag pas sangs rgyas pa la bdag ni bde ba la sogs pa 'du bar byed pa can
analyzed: brag pas sangs rgyas pa la bdag ni bde ba la sogs pa 'du bar byed pa can
translated: to a Buddhist, “The self is the one that brings together pleasure and so forth.”

original: zhes pa lta bu'o/_/rab tu grags pa yang 'brel te/_dper na me dro ba med🔽tshhad ma rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa bzhugs/🔽ces pa lta bu'o/_//'di rnams kyi brjod pa ni chos kyi rang bzhin 'gog par byed
analyzed: zhes pa lta bu'o/_/rab tu grags pa yang 'brel te/_dper na me dro ba med tshhad ma rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa bzhugs/ ces pa lta bu'o/_//'di rnams kyi brjod pa ni chos kyi rang bzhin 'gog par byed
translated: It is also related to well known things, as in the following example:🔽Fire is not without heat.🔽🔽The words of this text refute the nature of phenomena.🔽

original: pa'i sgo ste/_yang dag par rab tu rtogs pa med pa dang sgrub par byed pa 'bras🔽bu med pa'i phyir dam bca' ba'i skyon rnams so/_/ma grub pa dang ma nges pa🔽dang 'gal ba ste gsum po rnams ni gtan tshhigs ltar snang ba rnams so/_/de la🔽ma grub pa'i dbye ba bzhi ste/_gnyis ka la ma grub pa dang /_gang yang rung ba🔽la ma grub pa dang /_the tshhom za nas ma grub pa dang /_gzhi ma grub pa yang ngo🔽zhes pa'o/_/de la sgra mi rtag nyid sgrub pa la mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi
analyzed: pa'i sgo ste/_yang dag par rab tu rtogs pa med pa dang sgrub par byed pa 'bras🔽bu med pa'i phyir dam bca' ba'i skyon rnams so/_/ma grub pa dang ma nges pa🔽dang 'gal ba ste gsum po rnams ni gtan tshhigs ltar snang ba rnams so/_/de la🔽ma grub pa'i dbye ba bzhi ste/_gnyis ka la ma grub pa dang /_gang yang rung ba🔽la ma grub pa dang /_the tshhom za nas ma grub pa dang /_gzhi ma grub pa yang ngo🔽zhes pa'o/_/de la sgra mi rtag nyid sgrub pa la mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi
translated: It is also well known, for example, that fire is not without heat.

original: phyir zhes pa gnyis ka la ma grub pa'o/_/sgra mngon par gsal bar smra ba la/
analyzed: phyir zhes pa gnyis ka la ma grub pa'o/_/sgra mngon par gsal bar smra ba la/
translated: The two “because” are not established for the other.

original: byas pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa gang rung la ma grub pa'o/_/me sgrub pa la rlangs pa la
analyzed: byas pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa gang rung la ma grub pa'o/_/me sgrub pa la rlangs pa la
translated: “Because it is produced” is not established for either.

original: sogs pa'i dngos por the tshhom za ba'i 'byung ba 'dus pa brjod pa lta bu the tshhom🔽za nas ma grub pa'o/_/nam mkha' rjes su yod de/_yon tan gyi gzhi nyid kyi
analyzed: sogs pa'i dngos por the tshhom za ba'i 'byung ba 'dus pa brjod pa lta bu the tshhom za nas ma grub pa'o/_/nam mkha' rjes su yod de/_yon tan gyi gzhi nyid kyi
translated: When proving fire, the statement “the gathering of elements that are doubted to be things such as steam” is an🔽uncertain reason.

original: phyir zhes pa nam mkha'i yod pa nyid du brjod pa la gzhi ma grub pa'o/_/ma nges
analyzed: phyir zhes pa nam mkha'i yod pa nyid du brjod pa la gzhi ma grub pa'o/_/ma nges
translated: When stating that space exists because it is the basis of qualities, the basis is not established for the statement that space exists.

original: pa ni drug du dbye ste/_thun mong dang /_thun mong ma yin pa dang /_mthun🔽phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod la mi mthun phyogs la khyad pa dang /_mi mthun
analyzed: pa ni drug du dbye ste/_thun mong dang /_thun mong ma yin pa dang /_mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la yod la mi mthun phyogs la khyad pa dang /_mi mthun
translated: Uncertain reasons are divided into six: common, uncommon,🔽present in one part of the similar class but absent in the dissimilar class,🔽present in one part of the dissimilar class but absent in the similar class,

original: phyogs kyi phyogs cig 7gi yul la yod la mthun phyogs la khyab pa dang /_gnyis
analyzed: phyogs kyi phyogs cig 7gi yul la yod la mthun phyogs la khyab pa dang /_gnyis
translated: present in both the similar and dissimilar classes,🔽and absent in both the similar and dissimilar classes.

original: ka'i phyogs cig gi yul la yod pa dang /_'gal ba la mi 'khrul pa yang zhes pa'o/🔽de la thun mong pa 'di ltar gzhal bya nyid kyi phyir sgra rtag ces pa'o/_/de ni rtag
analyzed: ka'i phyogs cig gi yul la yod pa dang /_'gal ba la mi 'khrul pa yang zhes pa'o/ de la thun mong pa 'di ltar gzhal bya nyid kyi phyir sgra rtag ces pa'o/_/de ni rtag
translated: The object of one part of the “ka” is present, and the non-mistaken🔽aspect is “contradictory.”🔽The common one is, for example, “Sound is permanent because it is an🔽object of comprehension.” That is permanent.

original: mi rtag gi phyogs dag la thun mong pa nyid kyi phyir ma nges pa ste/_ji ltar bum pa
analyzed: mi rtag gi phyogs dag la thun mong pa nyid kyi phyir ma nges pa ste/_ji ltar bum pa
translated: The common reason is, for example, “Sound is permanent because it is an object of comprehension.” That is not ascertained because it is common to both the permanent and the impermanent.

original: la sogs pa bzhin gzhal bya nyid kyi phyir rtag ces pa lta bu'o/_/thun mong ma🔽yin pa ni mnyan bya nyid kyi phyir sgra rtag ces pa'o/_/de ni rtag mi rtag gi phyogs
analyzed: la sogs pa bzhin gzhal bya nyid kyi phyir rtag ces pa lta bu'o/_/thun mong ma yin pa ni mnyan bya nyid kyi phyir sgra rtag ces pa'o/_/de ni rtag mi rtag gi phyogs
translated: For example, it is like saying, “It is permanent because it is an object of comprehension, like a pot.”

original: dag las ldog pa nyid kyi phyir dang /_rtag mi rtag gi rnam par nges pa spangs
analyzed: dag las ldog pa nyid kyi phyir dang /_rtag mi rtag gi rnam par nges pa spangs
translated: The uncommon reason is, for example, “Sound is permanent because it is audible.” That is not ascertained because it is the opposite of both the permanent and the impermanent and because there is no other alternative to the permanent and the impermanent.

original: pa'i gzhan yang med pa'i phyir/_mnyan bya nyid 'di ji ltar na the tshhom gyi rgyu nyid
analyzed: pa'i gzhan yang med pa'i phyir/_mnyan bya nyid 'di ji ltar na the tshhom gyi rgyu nyid
translated: How is it that audibility is the cause of doubt?

original: do zhes pa'o/_/mthun phyogs kyi phyogs cig gis yul la yod la/_mi mthun
analyzed: do zhes pa'o/_/mthun phyogs kyi phyogs cig gis yul la yod la/_mi mthun
translated: The similar reason is, for example, “Sound is impermanent because it is produced, like a pot.” That is not ascertained because it is common to both the impermanent and the permanent.

original: phyogs la khyab pa ni sgra rtshol bas byung ba ma yin te/_mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes🔽pa'o/_/'di'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rtshol ba las byung ba'o/_/glog dang nam mkha' la sogs pa ni mthun phyogs so/_/de la yul gcig glog la sogs pa
analyzed: phyogs la khyab pa ni sgra rtshol bas byung ba ma yin te/_mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'o/_/'di'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rtshol ba las byung ba'o/_/glog dang nam mkha' la sogs pa ni mthun phyogs so/_/de la yul gcig glog la sogs pa
translated: impermanence.🔽The opposite of this is derived from inquiry. Lightning, space, and so forth🔽are similar instances. Impermanence exists in one object, lightning, and so

original: la mi rtag pa nyid yod la nam mkha' la sogs pa la med cing 'di'i mthun phyogs
analyzed: la mi rtag pa nyid yod la nam mkha' la sogs pa la med cing 'di'i mthun phyogs
translated: forth, but not in space, and so forth. The similar instances of this are derived

original: rtshol ma byung dang mi mthun phyogs bum pa la sogs pa'o/_/de la thams cad la
analyzed: rtshol ma byung dang mi mthun phyogs bum pa la sogs pa'o/_/de la thams cad la
translated: from inquiry, and the opposite instances are vases, and so forth. Impermanence🔽exists in all of these. But because lightning and a vase are similar instances,

original: mi rtag pa nyid yod la 'di'i yang glog dang bum pa chos mthun pa'i phyir ma nges
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid yod la 'di'i yang glog dang bum pa chos mthun pa'i phyir ma nges
translated: this is not ascertained.

original: pa'o/_/ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa bzhin mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir rtshol ba las
analyzed: pa'o/_/ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa bzhin mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir rtshol ba las
translated: “Because of impermanence, like a vase, and so forth, it is derived from🔽inquiry.”🔽It exists in one object of the opposite instances, but not in the similar

original: byung zhes pa lta bu'o/_/mi mthun phyogs kyi yul gcig la yod la mthun phyogs la
analyzed: byung zhes pa lta bu'o/_/mi mthun phyogs kyi yul gcig la yod la mthun phyogs la
translated: instances.

original: khyab pa ni/_ji ltar sgra rtshol ba las byung ba yin te mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes
analyzed: khyab pa ni/_ji ltar sgra rtshol ba las byung ba yin te mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes
translated: Whatever is a product is necessarily impermanent, like a pot.

original: pa'o/_/rtshol ba las byung ba'i sgra ni 'di'i phyogs so/_/bum pa la sogs pa
analyzed: pa'o/_/rtshol ba las byung ba'i sgra ni 'di'i phyogs so/_/bum pa la sogs pa
translated: The subject is sound.

original: ni mthun phyogs de la bum pa la sogs pa thams cad la mi rtag pa nyid do/_/
analyzed: ni mthun phyogs de la bum pa la sogs pa thams cad la mi rtag pa nyid do/_/
translated: The similar class is all impermanent things, such as a pot.

original: glog dang nam mkha' la sogs pa ni mi mthun phyogs so/_/de la glog la sogs
analyzed: glog dang nam mkha' la sogs pa ni mi mthun phyogs so/_/de la glog la sogs
translated: The dissimilar class is permanent things, such as space and lightning.

original: pa la mi rtag pa nyid yod la/_nam mkha' la sogs pa la med pa de'i phyir 'di
analyzed: pa la mi rtag pa nyid yod la/_nam mkha' la sogs pa la med pa de'i phyir 'di
translated: Since lightning is impermanent and space is not, this reason is also, as before, inconclusive.

original: yang snga ma bzhin ma nges pa'o/_/gnyis ka'i phyogs gcig gi yul la yod pa ni/
analyzed: yang snga ma bzhin ma nges pa'o/_/gnyis ka'i phyogs gcig gi yul la yod pa ni/
translated: The third type of reason is one that is present in only one part of the similar class and the dissimilar class.

original: ji ltar sgra rtag ste lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa 'di la rtag pa ni phyogs
analyzed: ji ltar sgra rtag ste lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa 'di la rtag pa ni phyogs
translated: For example, “Sound is permanent because it is not corporeal.” Here the similar class is permanent things.

original: so/_/nam mkha' dang rdul phran la sogs pa ni mthun phyogs so/_/de la
analyzed: so/_/nam mkha' dang rdul phran la sogs pa ni mthun phyogs so/_/de la
translated: Space and atoms are the similar class.

original: mthun phyogs kyi yul cig nam mkha' la lus can ma yin pa nyid yod la rdul phran
analyzed: mthun phyogs kyi yul cig nam mkha' la lus can ma yin pa nyid yod la rdul phran
translated: The property of the similar class is that something is not a physical object in space. It exists in space but not in atoms and so forth.

original: la sogs pa la med do/_/'di'i mi rtag pa'i phyogs bum pa dang bde ba la
analyzed: la sogs pa la med do/_/'di'i mi rtag pa'i phyogs bum pa dang bde ba la
translated: The property of the dissimilar class is the impermanent side of a pot, happiness and so forth.🔽Happiness and so forth are not physical objects.

original: sogs pa ni mi mthun phyogs so/_/de la bde ba la sogs pa ni lus can ma yin🔽tshhad tshhad ma rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa bzhugs🔽pa nyid yod la bum pa la med do/_/de'i phyir 'di yang bde ba dang nam mkha'
analyzed: sogs pa ni mi mthun phyogs so/_/de la bde ba la sogs pa ni lus can ma yin tshhad tshhad ma rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa bzhugs pa nyid yod la bum pa la med do/_/de'i phyir 'di yang bde ba dang nam mkha'
translated: The property of the dissimilar class is that a pot is not a physical object.

original: chos mthun pa'i dper byas pa nyid kyis ma nges pa'o/_/'gal ba la mi 'khrul pa
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i dper byas pa nyid kyis ma nges pa'o/_/'gal ba la mi 'khrul pa
translated: It exists in happiness but not in a pot. Therefore, since this is also an example that is similar to the property of the subject, it is not ascertained.

original: ni ji ltar sgra mi rtag ste byas pa nyid kyi phyir bum pa bzhin sgra rtag ste mnyan bya nyid
analyzed: ni ji ltar sgra mi rtag ste byas pa nyid kyi phyir bum pa bzhin sgra rtag ste mnyan bya nyid
translated: The nonerroneous with regard to the contradictory is, for example, “Sound is impermanent because it is produced, like a pot. Sound is permanent because it is audible, like sound.”

original: kyi phyir sgra bzhin zhes pa 'gal ba'i don dag gcig la yod pa ni gnyis gnyis ka la the
analyzed: kyi phyir sgra bzhin zhes pa 'gal ba'i don dag gcig la yod pa ni gnyis gnyis ka la the
translated: The contradictory meanings exist in one thing.

original: tshhom gyi rgyu nyid do/_/'gal ba ni bzhir dbye ste/_chos kyi rang bzhin phyin ci
analyzed: tshhom gyi rgyu nyid do/_/'gal ba ni bzhir dbye ste/_chos kyi rang bzhin phyin ci
translated: Contradiction is divided into four types:

original: log tu sgrub par byed pa dang /_chos kyi khyad par phyin ci log tu bsgrub par
analyzed: log tu sgrub par byed pa dang /_chos kyi khyad par phyin ci log tu bsgrub par
translated: establishing the nature of a phenomenon in a contradictory way,🔽establishing the attributes of a phenomenon in a contradictory way,🔽establishing the nature of the subject in a contradictory way, and

original: byed pa dang /_chos can gyi rang bzhin phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa dang / chos can gyi khyad par phyin ci log tu bsgrub par byed pa yang ngo zhes pa'o/_/de
analyzed: byed pa dang /_chos can gyi rang bzhin phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa dang / chos can gyi khyad par phyin ci log tu bsgrub par byed pa yang ngo zhes pa'o/_/de
translated: establishing the attributes of the subject in a contradictory way.

original: la chos kyi rang bzhin phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa ji ltar na/_sgra rtag ste
analyzed: la chos kyi rang bzhin phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa ji ltar na/_sgra rtag ste
translated: How is the nature of a phenomenon established in a contradictory way?

original: byas pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'am btshal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyi phyir/_zhes
analyzed: byas pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'am btshal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyi phyir/_zhes
translated: Sound is permanent because it is produced or because it arises in dependence on something else.

original: 'di'i rtags mi mthun phyogs kho na la yod pas 'gal ba'o/_/chos kyi khyad par
analyzed: 'di'i rtags mi mthun phyogs kho na la yod pas 'gal ba'o/_/chos kyi khyad par
translated: Here the reason is present only in the discordant class, so it is contradictory.🔽How is the attribute of a phenomenon established in a contradictory way?

original: phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa ji ltar na/_mig la sogs pa gzhan gyi don
analyzed: phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa ji ltar na/_mig la sogs pa gzhan gyi don
translated: The eyes and so forth are for the benefit of others

original: yin te/_'dus pa nyid kyi phyir mal cha dang stan la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin🔽zhes pa 'di'i rtags ji ltar mig la sogs pa rnams la gzhan gyi don nyid sgrub🔽par byed pa de ltar 'dus pa nyid kyang gzhan gyi sgrub par byed pa yin la mal cha
analyzed: yin te/_'dus pa nyid kyi phyir mal cha dang stan la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin zhes pa 'di'i rtags ji ltar mig la sogs pa rnams la gzhan gyi don nyid sgrub par byed pa de ltar 'dus pa nyid kyang gzhan gyi sgrub par byed pa yin la mal cha
translated: Because they are a collection, like the four parts of a bed and bedding.

original: dang stan la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams kyang 'dus pa nyid yin pas so/_/chos🔽can gyi rang bzhin phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa ji ltar na/_rdzas dang las
analyzed: dang stan la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams kyang 'dus pa nyid yin pas so/_/chos can gyi rang bzhin phyin ci log tu sgrub par byed pa ji ltar na/_rdzas dang las
translated: Just as the reason in the proof of the eyes and so on as having the purpose of others is “because they are a collection,” the reason in the proof of the collection as having the purpose of others is “because they are a collection.” The reason in the proof of the parts of a bed and bedding as having the purpose of a bed and bedding is “because they are a collection.”

original: dang yon tan so sor med de dngos po'i rdzas gcig pa can nyid kyi phyir dang / yon tan dang las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir/_spyi dang khyad par bzhin zhes
analyzed: dang yon tan so sor med de dngos po'i rdzas gcig pa can nyid kyi phyir dang / yon tan dang las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir/_spyi dang khyad par bzhin zhes
translated: Just as the reason in the proof of the nature of the subject as mistaken is “because they are not individually substances, actions, or qualities, because they are a single substance of an entity, and because they are the nature of qualities and actions,” the reason in the proof of the nature of the subject as unmistaken is “because they are not general and specific, because they are a single substance of an entity, and because they are the nature of qualities and actions.”

original: pa 'di'i rtags ji ltar rdzas la sogs pa'i ma yin pa la sgrub par byed pa'i dngos
analyzed: pa 'di'i rtags ji ltar rdzas la sogs pa'i ma yin pa la sgrub par byed pa'i dngos
translated: Just as the reason in the proof of substances and so on as not being non-non-substances and so on is “because they are not general and specific,” the reason in the proof of substances and so on as not being non-substances and so on is “because they are not general and specific.”

original: po yin pa de ltar dngos po'i yod pa nyid la yang bsgrub par byed pa yin te
analyzed: po yin pa de ltar dngos po'i yod pa nyid la yang bsgrub par byed pa yin te
translated: In the same way, the existence of things is also established because

original: /   gnyis ka la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro/_/chos can gyi khyad par phyin ci log tu sgrub
analyzed: /   gnyis ka la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro/_/chos can gyi khyad par phyin ci log tu sgrub
translated: it is not mistaken with regard to both.

original: par byed pa 'di nyid ni phyogs snga ma'i rtags 'di nyid la chos can gyi khyad par
analyzed: par byed pa 'di nyid ni phyogs snga ma'i rtags 'di nyid la chos can gyi khyad par
translated: This establishment of the specific property of the subject is also a proof🔽of the property of the subject in the opponent’s reason because it is not🔽mistaken with regard to both.

original: gang yod pa rkyen gyis byas pa nyid dang /_de'i bzlog pa med pa rkyen gyis byas
analyzed: gang yod pa rkyen gyis byas pa nyid dang /_de'i bzlog pa med pa rkyen gyis byas
translated: The existence of something is produced by conditions, and the opposite🔽of that is not produced by conditions. This is also a proof because it is not

original: pa nyid la yang sgrub par byed pa yin te/_gnyis ka la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro/_/
analyzed: pa nyid la yang sgrub par byed pa yin te/_gnyis ka la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro/_/
translated: mistaken with regard to both.🔽The fallacious examples are as follows: the property to be proven is not🔽established in the proof, the property to be established is not established,🔽both properties are not established, there is no pervasion, and there is a

original: dpe ltar snang ba rnams 'di lta ste/_sgrub par byed pa'i chos ma grub pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ma grub pa dang /_gnyis ka'i chos ma grub pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang /_rjes su 'gro ba phyin ci log pa yang ngo /_/zhes
analyzed: dpe ltar snang ba rnams 'di lta ste/_sgrub par byed pa'i chos ma grub pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ma grub pa dang /_gnyis ka'i chos ma grub pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang /_rjes su 'gro ba phyin ci log pa yang ngo /_/zhes
translated: pervasion that is reversed.

original: pa chos mthun pa nyid kyis so/_/chos mi mthun pa nyid la yang sgrub par byed pa
analyzed: pa chos mthun pa nyid kyis so/_/chos mi mthun pa nyid la yang sgrub par byed pa
translated: The reason is dissimilar to the predicate.🔽The reason is not absent.🔽The reason is not absent from the similar instances.

original: ldog pa med pa dang /_sgrub par byed pa ldog pa med pa dang /_gnyis ka
analyzed: ldog pa med pa dang /_sgrub par byed pa ldog pa med pa dang /_gnyis ka
translated: The reason is not absent from the dissimilar instances.🔽The reason is absent from the similar instances.🔽The reason is absent from the dissimilar instances.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The reason is unestablished.

original: ldog pa med pa dang /_ldog pa med pa dang /_ldog pa phyin ci log pa yang
analyzed: ldog pa med pa dang /_ldog pa med pa dang /_ldog pa phyin ci log pa yang
translated: The predicate is unestablished.🔽The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.

original: zhes pa'o/_/de la sgrub par byed pa'i chos ma grub pa ni ji ltar sgra rtag ste
analyzed: zhes pa'o/_/de la sgrub par byed pa'i chos ma grub pa ni ji ltar sgra rtag ste
translated: The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.🔽The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.

original: lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir gang lus can ma yin pa de rtag par mthong ste/🔽dper na rdul phra rab bzhin zhes pa de la phra rab la bsgrub par bya ba rtag pa nyid
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir gang lus can ma yin pa de rtag par mthong ste/ dper na rdul phra rab bzhin zhes pa de la phra rab la bsgrub par bya ba rtag pa nyid
translated: The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.🔽The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.

original: yod la sgrub par byed pa'i chos lus can ma yin pa nyid med de/_rdul phran
analyzed: yod la sgrub par byed pa'i chos lus can ma yin pa nyid med de/_rdul phran
translated: The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.

original: rnams lus can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro/_/bsgrub bya'i chos ma grub pa ni/_'di
analyzed: rnams lus can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro/_/bsgrub bya'i chos ma grub pa ni/_'di
translated: The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.

original: ltar sgra rtag ste lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir/_gang lus can ma yin pa nyid
analyzed: ltar sgra rtag ste lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir/_gang lus can ma yin pa nyid
translated: The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.🔽The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.🔽The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.🔽The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.🔽The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.🔽The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.🔽The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.🔽The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.🔽The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.🔽The reason is unestablished.🔽The reason is contradictory.🔽The reason is inconclusive.🔽The predicate is unestablished.🔽The reason is

original: de rtag par mthong ste dper na blo bzhin zhes pa/_blo la sgrub par byed pa'i chos
analyzed: de rtag par mthong ste dper na blo bzhin zhes pa/_blo la sgrub par byed pa'i chos
translated: The example is like the mind,🔽which has the property of being nonembodiment,

original: lus can ma yin pa nyid yod la bsgrub bya'i chos rtag pa nyid med de blo mi rtag pa🔽nyid kyi phyir ro/_/gnyis ka ma grub pa ni gnyis su dbye ste/_yod pa dang med
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa nyid yod la bsgrub bya'i chos rtag pa nyid med de blo mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro/_/gnyis ka ma grub pa ni gnyis su dbye ste/_yod pa dang med
translated: but does not have the property to be proven, permanence, because the mind is impermanent.🔽The second type of reason that is not established in both is called “both existent and nonexistent.”

original: pa yang zhes so/_/de la bum pa bzhin zhes pa yod pa la gnyis ka la ma grub pa ste/
analyzed: pa yang zhes so/_/de la bum pa bzhin zhes pa yod pa la gnyis ka la ma grub pa ste/
translated: The example is like a pot, which is not established in both for existence and nonexistence.

original: lus can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /_mi rtag pa nyid kyi yang phyir ro/_/nam🔽tshhad ma rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa bzhugs/🔽mkha' bzhin zhes pa med pa gnyis ka ma grub pa ste/_nam mkha' med pa nyid du
analyzed: lus can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /_mi rtag pa nyid kyi yang phyir ro/_/nam tshhad ma rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa bzhugs/ mkha' bzhin zhes pa med pa gnyis ka ma grub pa ste/_nam mkha' med pa nyid du
translated: This is because it is embodied and impermanent.🔽The example is like space, which is not established in both for nonexistence and existence.🔽This is because space is asserted to be nonexistent.

original: 'dod pa la'o/_/rjes su 'gro ba med pa ni gang la rjes su 'gro ba med pas
analyzed: 'dod pa la'o/_/rjes su 'gro ba med pa ni gang la rjes su 'gro ba med pas
translated: The second type of reason that is not established in both is called “lack of pervasion.”

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang /_sgrub par byed pa dag lhan cig yod par rab tu shes
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang /_sgrub par byed pa dag lhan cig yod par rab tu shes
translated: This is when the property to be proven and the proof are known to exist together.

original: par byed pa ji ltar bum pa la byas pa nyid dang /_mi rtag pa nyid kyang mthong
analyzed: par byed pa ji ltar bum pa la byas pa nyid dang /_mi rtag pa nyid kyang mthong
translated: The forward pervasion is that whatever is a product is seen to be impermanent.

original: zhes pa'o/_/rjes su 'gro ba phyin ci log pa ni gang byas pa de mi rtag par mthong
analyzed: zhes pa'o/_/rjes su 'gro ba phyin ci log pa ni gang byas pa de mi rtag par mthong
translated: The reverse pervasion is that whatever is impermanent is seen to be a product.

original: zhes brjod par bya ba las gang mi rtag pa de byas pa yin zhes zer ba lta bu'o/_/🔽chos mi mthun pa la yang sgrub par byed pa ldog pa med pa ni/_re zhig las la🔽bsgrub bya rtag pa nyid ldog ste las rnams mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro/_/sgrub par
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya ba las gang mi rtag pa de byas pa yin zhes zer ba lta bu'o/_/ chos mi mthun pa la yang sgrub par byed pa ldog pa med pa ni/_re zhig las la bsgrub bya rtag pa nyid ldog ste las rnams mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro/_/sgrub par
translated: The non-exclusion of the establishment of the predicate is, for example, “Whatever is a product is impermanent.”🔽The non-exclusion of the establishment of the reason is, for example, “Whatever is impermanent is a product.”🔽The non-exclusion of the predicate to be established is, for example, “Actions are permanent.”

original: byed pa ldog pa med de las rnams lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro/_/bsgrub
analyzed: byed pa ldog pa med de las rnams lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro/_/bsgrub
translated: The non-exclusion of the establishment of the reason is, for example, “Actions are not embodied.”

original: par bya ba ldog pa med pa ni rdul phra rab bzhin zhes pa la sgrub par byed pa lus
analyzed: par bya ba ldog pa med pa ni rdul phra rab bzhin zhes pa la sgrub par byed pa lus
translated: The non-exclusion of the predicate to be established is, for example, “Actions are like subtle particles.”

original: can ma yin pa nyid ldog ste/_rdul phran rnams lus can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro/_/
analyzed: can ma yin pa nyid ldog ste/_rdul phran rnams lus can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro/_/
translated: The non-exclusion of the establishment of the reason is, for example, “The subtle particles are embodied.”

original: bsgrub par bya ba rtag pa nyid ldog pa med de/_rdul phran rnams rtag pa nyid kyi
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba rtag pa nyid ldog pa med de/_rdul phran rnams rtag pa nyid kyi
translated: The thesis, permanence, is not refuted because the atoms are permanent.

original: phyir ro/_/gnyis ka ldog pa med pa ni nam mkha' bzhin zhes pa la rtag pa nyid🔽dang /_lus can ma yin pa nyid ldog pa ma yin pa nyid ldog pa med de nam
analyzed: phyir ro/_/gnyis ka ldog pa med pa ni nam mkha' bzhin zhes pa la rtag pa nyid dang /_lus can ma yin pa nyid ldog pa ma yin pa nyid ldog pa med de nam
translated: The non-refutation of both is like space, where permanence

original: mkha' rtag pa nyid kyi phyir dang /_lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi yang phyir ro/_/🔽ldog pa med pa ni ji ltar nam mkha' la rtag pa nyid dang /_ma byas pa nyid kyang🔽mthong zhes pa lta bu'o/_/ldog pa phyin ci log pa ni ji ltar gang rtag ste byas pa ma
analyzed: mkha' rtag pa nyid kyi phyir dang /_lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi yang phyir ro/_/ ldog pa med pa ni ji ltar nam mkha' la rtag pa nyid dang /_ma byas pa nyid kyang mthong zhes pa lta bu'o/_/ldog pa phyin ci log pa ni ji ltar gang rtag ste byas pa ma
translated: and incorporeality are not refuted because space is permanent and incorporeal.🔽The non-refutation of the non-refutation is like the case of space, where permanence and incorporeality are seen.

original: yin zhes brjod par bya ba las gang ma byas pa de rtag pa yin zhes zer ba lta bu'o//
analyzed: yin zhes brjod par bya ba las gang ma byas pa de rtag pa yin zhes zer ba lta bu'o//
translated: The reversed refutation is like the case of the statement, “Whatever is permanent is not produced,” where the reversal is, “Whatever is not produced is permanent.”

original: 'di rnams kyis phyogs dang gtan tshhigs dang dpe ltar snang ba rnams brjod pas
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis phyogs dang gtan tshhigs dang dpe ltar snang ba rnams brjod pas
translated: These are the fallacies of the position, reason, and example.

original: sgrub par byed par ltar snang ba rnams so/_/bdag nyid kyis rab tu rtogs par
analyzed: sgrub par byed par ltar snang ba rnams so/_/bdag nyid kyis rab tu rtogs par
translated: and the apparent means of accomplishment.🔽🔽

original: bya ba'i don la yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshhad ma nyid dag go/_/🔽de la mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba ste/_shes pa gang gzugs la sogs pa'i
analyzed: bya ba'i don la yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshhad ma nyid dag go/_/ de la mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba ste/_shes pa gang gzugs la sogs pa'i
translated: The means of valid cognition are direct perception and inference.🔽Direct perception is free from conceptual thought.

original: don la ming dang rigs la sogs pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba de dbang po so so'i
analyzed: don la ming dang rigs la sogs pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba de dbang po so so'i
translated: The consciousness that is free from conceptual thought of names, types, and so forth in regard to objects such as form is direct perception.

original: dbang po la yod pa ni mngon sum zhes pa'o/_/rjes su dpag pa ni rtags las
analyzed: dbang po la yod pa ni mngon sum zhes pa'o/_/rjes su dpag pa ni rtags las
translated: The individual sense organs are the basis of direct perception.🔽Inference is seeing an object from a sign.

original: don mthong ba'o/_/rtags ni tshhul gsum tshhang bar brjod pa gang las gang rjes
analyzed: don mthong ba'o/_/rtags ni tshhul gsum tshhang bar brjod pa gang las gang rjes
translated: The sign is said to be the three modes.🔽From that, the consciousness that infers arises.

original: su dpag pa'i shes pa skyes pa 'dir me dang bum pa mi rtag ces pa la sogs pa🔽'di rjes su dpag pa'o/_/gnyis ka la shes pa de nyid 'bras bu ste/_gzugs
analyzed: su dpag pa'i shes pa skyes pa 'dir me dang bum pa mi rtag ces pa la sogs pa 'di rjes su dpag pa'o/_/gnyis ka la shes pa de nyid 'bras bu ste/_gzugs
translated: Here, inference is such as “There is fire there because there is smoke,” “The pot is impermanent,” and so forth.🔽In both cases, that consciousness is the result because it is the realization of form and so forth.

original: las sogs pa rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro/_/tshhad ma'ang de nyid de/_don byed
analyzed: las sogs pa rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro/_/tshhad ma'ang de nyid de/_don byed
translated: It is also valid cognition because it is the valid cognition of the object’s function.

original: nus pa yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir zhes pa'o/_/don gzhan la rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa gang skyes pa de mngon sum ltar snang ba'o/_/ji ltar na bum🔽pa'am snam bu zhes rtog pa dang bcas pa de rang gi mtshhan nyid kyi yul nyid las🔽mngon sum ltar snang ba'o/_/sngar gyi rtags ltar snang las rtogs pa don ltar
analyzed: nus pa yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir zhes pa'o/_/don gzhan la rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa gang skyes pa de mngon sum ltar snang ba'o/_/ji ltar na bum pa'am snam bu zhes rtog pa dang bcas pa de rang gi mtshhan nyid kyi yul nyid las mngon sum ltar snang ba'o/_/sngar gyi rtags ltar snang las rtogs pa don ltar
translated: Any cognition that arises with the conception of another object is a seeming direct perception.🔽How is it that a cognition that conceives of a pot or a cloth is a seeming direct perception?🔽It is a seeming direct perception because it is a cognition of a specifically characterized object.

original: snang ba'i shes pa ni rjes dpag pa ltar snang ba ste/_rtags ltar snang gi dbye ba🔽mang po brjod pa de las rjes su dpag par bya ba ltar snang ba'i shes pa ma rtogs
analyzed: snang ba'i shes pa ni rjes dpag pa ltar snang ba ste/_rtags ltar snang gi dbye ba mang po brjod pa de las rjes su dpag par bya ba ltar snang ba'i shes pa ma rtogs
translated: A cognition that understands an object in accordance with a seeming reason is a seeming inference.🔽There are many divisions of seeming reasons,

original: par 'gyur ba de ni rjes dpag ltar snang ba'o/_/sgrub par byed pa'i skyon brjod
analyzed: par 'gyur ba de ni rjes dpag ltar snang ba'o/_/sgrub par byed pa'i skyon brjod
translated: and from among them, a cognition that understands a seeming object of inference is a seeming inference.🔽The statements of faults in a proof are refutations.

original: pa rnams ni sun 'byin pa rnams so/_/sgrub par byed pa'i skyon yang ma tshhang ba
analyzed: pa rnams ni sun 'byin pa rnams so/_/sgrub par byed pa'i skyon yang ma tshhang ba
translated: The faults of a proof are the incompleteness of a proof

original: dang /_mngon sum la sogs pa gnod phyogs kyi skyon nyid dang /_rtags kyi
analyzed: dang /_mngon sum la sogs pa gnod phyogs kyi skyon nyid dang /_rtags kyi
translated: and the faults of the side of the refutation, such as contradiction by direct perception and so forth.

original: skyon ma grub pa'i rtags nyid dang /_ma nges pa'i rtags nyid dang /_'gal
analyzed: skyon ma grub pa'i rtags nyid dang /_ma nges pa'i rtags nyid dang /_'gal
translated: The faults of the reason are: the reason is not established, the reason is uncertain, the reason is contradictory,

original: ba'i rtags nyid dang /_dpe'i skyon nyid dang /_bsgrub bya'i chos la sogs pa
analyzed: ba'i rtags nyid dang /_dpe'i skyon nyid dang /_bsgrub bya'i chos la sogs pa
translated: the fault of the example, and the thesis and so forth are not established.

original: ma grub pa'o/_/de'i brjod pa'i phyir rgol gyis rab tu rtogs pa'i dus na sun🔽'byin pa'o/_/sgrub par byed pa skyon mi 'byung ba la skyon brjod pa rnams ni sun
analyzed: ma grub pa'o/_/de'i brjod pa'i phyir rgol gyis rab tu rtogs pa'i dus na sun 'byin pa'o/_/sgrub par byed pa skyon mi 'byung ba la skyon brjod pa rnams ni sun
translated: Because of that, at the time of the opponent's understanding, there is refutation.🔽The expression of faults in a proof that is free of faults is a pseudo-refutation.

original: 'byin ltar snang ba rnams te/_ji ltar na sgrub par byed pa yang dag par tshhang ba
analyzed: 'byin ltar snang ba rnams te/_ji ltar na sgrub par byed pa yang dag par tshhang ba
translated: How is it that a correct proof is not understood and an incorrect proof is understood?

original: tshhad ma rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa bzhugs/🔽la ma tshhang ba nyid brjod pa dang phyogs skyon med pa la phyogs kyi skyon brjod pa
analyzed: tshhad ma rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa bzhugs/ la ma tshhang ba nyid brjod pa dang phyogs skyon med pa la phyogs kyi skyon brjod pa
translated: The Entrance to the System of Logic called the Door of Right Knowledge🔽The expression of what is not understood in a correct proof, the expression of the faults of a faultless position,

original: dang grub pa'i rtags la ma grub pa'i rtags su ma nges pa med pa'i rtags la ma
analyzed: dang grub pa'i rtags la ma grub pa'i rtags su ma nges pa med pa'i rtags la ma
translated: the expression of the uncertainty of an unestablished reason in an established reason, and the expression of a non-contradictory reason as contradictory🔽are pseudo-refutations.

original: nges pa'i rtags su brjod pa dang /_mi 'gal ba'i rtags la 'gal ba'i rtags
analyzed: nges pa'i rtags su brjod pa dang /_mi 'gal ba'i rtags la 'gal ba'i rtags
translated: The expression of a sign that is not ascertained, the expression of a sign that is contradictory in a sign that is not contradictory,

original: su brjod pa dang /_skyon med pa'i dpe la dpe'i skyon brjod pa ste/_'di🔽rnams sun 'byin ltar snang ba rnams so/_/'di rnams kyis gzhan gyi phyogs la
analyzed: su brjod pa dang /_skyon med pa'i dpe la dpe'i skyon brjod pa ste/_'di rnams sun 'byin ltar snang ba rnams so/_/'di rnams kyis gzhan gyi phyogs la
translated: and the expression of the faults of an example in an example that is faultless—

original: skyon med pa ma brjod de skyon med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa re zhig bzhag go/_/
analyzed: skyon med pa ma brjod de skyon med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa re zhig bzhag go/_/
translated: these are the fallacious refutations. They do not express the faultlessness of the position of the other, because it is faultless.🔽Having explained a little of the meaning of the words,

original: tshhig don cung zad kun bshad pa/_/sngon la phyogs tsham bsgrubs pa'i phyir/_/
analyzed: tshhig don cung zad kun bshad pa/_/sngon la phyogs tsham bsgrubs pa'i phyir/_/
translated: first, in order to establish the position,🔽whatever is reasonable or unreasonable,

original: gang 'dir rigs dang mi rigs kyang /_/gzhan las de dag legs zhes bya/_/
analyzed: gang 'dir rigs dang mi rigs kyang /_/gzhan las de dag legs zhes bya/_/
translated: that is well-known from others.

original: zhes pa rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo slob dpon chen po phyogs kyi glang pos mdzad
analyzed: zhes pa rigs par 'jug pa'i sgo slob dpon chen po phyogs kyi glang pos mdzad
translated: This is the conclusion of the Entrance to Reasoning composed by the great master Dignāga.🔽It was translated by the great Kashmiri paṇḍita Śrīdhara and the

original: pa rdzogs so//_// kha che'i pan+di ta chen po thams cad mkhyen dpal bsrung ba las/_shakya'i
analyzed: pa rdzogs so//_// kha che'i pan+di ta chen po thams cad mkhyen dpal bsrung ba las/_shakya'i
translated: Shakya

original: dge slong grags pa rgyal mtshhan dpal bzang pos/_dpal sa skya'i gtshug lag
analyzed: dge slong grags pa rgyal mtshhan dpal bzang pos/_dpal sa skya'i gtshug lag
translated: bhikṣu Drakpa Gyaltsen Pal Zangpo at the glorious Sakya temple.

original: khang chen por bsgyur ba'o//_//
analyzed: khang chen por bsgyur ba'o//_//
translated: and the great house is transformed.
